title: How to Transfer Photos from iPhone to PC: 3 Simple Ways

steps.title: Connect your iPhone
steps.content: Connect your iPhone to the PC. Use the USB charging cable that came with your phone. If this is the first time connecting your iPhone to the computer, you will need to tap Trust on the iPhone and then enter your iPhone's passcode, Touch ID, or Face ID. [1] X Research source Be sure to update your iPhone .

steps.title: On your computer, open iTunes.
steps.content: On your computer, open iTunes. This resembles a multicolored musical note on a white background. In order for a Windows computer to recognize an iPhone, you must open iTunes and allow the phone to connect to it. [2] X Research source If you don't have iTunes, you'll need to install it . You'll need iTunes version 12.5.1 or later.

steps.title: Wait for the "Device" icon to appear.
steps.content: Wait for the "Device" icon to appear. This iPhone-shaped icon will appear in the upper-left side of the iTunes Library page. Once you see it appear, you can proceed. [3] X Research source It may take several seconds for your iPhone to connect to iTunes. If the Library tab near the top of the iTunes window isn't highlighted, click it to shift to Library view.

steps.title: On your computer, open the Photos app.
steps.content: On your computer, open the Photos app. This looks like two mountains with a blue background. You can find this app by clicking the Start menu. Locate Photos in your App Library, or type Photos into the search bar.

steps.title: Click the "Import" icon.
steps.content: Click the "Import" icon. This is the icon of the down-arrow in front of a photo square. You can find this in the top-right corner of the Photos window. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click From a connected device.
steps.content: Click From a connected device . This is the bottom option in the drop-down menu. Your computer will begin looking for new photos and videos.

steps.title: Select the pictures you want to import and click Continue.
steps.content: Select the pictures you want to import and click Continue . All selected items will have a checkmark in the top-right of the preview image. You can also click Select All at the top to select all the pictures and video.

steps.title: Click Import.
steps.content: Click Import . This will begin importing the images and videos from the iPhone. You can check the box next to "Delete imported items from Apple iPhone after importing" if you don't want to keep the original photos or videos on the iPhone.

steps.title: Connect your iPhone to the PC.
steps.content: Connect your iPhone to the PC. Use the USB charging cable that came with your phone.

steps.title: Unlock your iPhone.
steps.content: Unlock your iPhone. Unlock your iPhone using Touch ID or your phone's passcode. This will prompt a question asking if you want to trust the computer you just connected to. [4] X Research source

steps.title: On the iPhone, tap Trust or Allow.
steps.content: On the iPhone, tap Trust or Allow . This allows the iPhone to share data with the computer so you can download the pictures and video.

steps.title: On your computer, open the File Explorer .
steps.content: On your computer, open the File Explorer . File Explorer allows you to browse files and devices connected to your computer.

steps.title: Locate the connected iPhone.
steps.content: Locate the connected iPhone. It should be listed on the left-side of the File Explorer window under "This PC". Click the arrow next to This PC to see a list of connected devices. If the iPhone doesn't appear, try disconnecting the iPhone and plugging it back in.

steps.title: Right-click on the iPhone and select Import pictures and video.
steps.content: Right-click on the iPhone and select Import pictures and video . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu. If you have a lot of photos, it may take a few moments to load.

steps.title: Select the Import all new items now option and click Next.
steps.content: Select the Import all new items now option and click Next . This will automatically import all the images and videos stored on your iPhone to your Pictures folder. Once finished importing, the Pictures folder will open automatically. You can also select Review, organize, and group items to import if you only want to select certain folders or photos. A window will open with your importing status. Depending on the number of files you're transferring, this can take up to ten minutes or longer. Check the box next to Erase after importing if you want to delete the photos from your phone when the process is complete.

steps.title: Locate your photos.
steps.content: Locate your photos. The folder will automatically open in your Pictures folder. To find it, open File Explorer and click Pictures . You can also search for it in the Start menu.

steps.title: Ensure that you have enough storage space.
steps.content: Ensure that you have enough storage space. This method allows you to upload all of your photos to iCloud, at which point you can download them onto any computer with Internet access. However, you must have enough storage space to support the photos you want to transfer. You start with 5 gigabytes of free storage, but you may need to upgrade your storage before you can store your photos.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. This is the grey cog icon.

steps.title: Tap your Apple ID.
steps.content: Tap your Apple ID. This can be found at the very top of Settings. You'll see your name and profile picture. If you are not signed in, tap Sign in to iPhone , enter your Apple ID and password, then tap Sign In . You can also create an Apple ID.

steps.title: Tap iCloud.
steps.content: Tap iCloud . This will be below Subscriptions , next to a blue cloud icon. You'll be able to see your storage space next to iCloud .

steps.title: Tap Photos.
steps.content: Tap Photos . This is underneath the Apps using iCloud header.

steps.title: Toggle on "Sync this iPhone".
steps.content: Toggle on "Sync this iPhone". Your Camera Roll photos and videos will be uploaded to your iCloud account as long as you're connected to Wi-Fi. If you have a lot of photos, this may take some time to sync.

steps.title: On your computer, go to the iCloud website.
steps.content: On your computer, go to the iCloud website . Enter your Apple ID and password, then click the arrow to log in. If you're already logged in, skip this step.

steps.title: Click Photos.
steps.content: Click Photos. It's a multicolored pinwheel-shaped icon.

steps.title: Click the Photos tab.
steps.content: Click the Photos tab. You can find this in the upper-left side of the page.

steps.title: Select photos to download.
steps.content: Select photos to download. You can select multiple photos by holding CTRL and clicking each photo.

steps.title: Click the "Download" button .
steps.content: Click the "Download" button . This is the cloud-shaped icon with a downward-facing arrow that's in the top-right side of the page. Your photos will download onto your computer. You may be asked to choose a destination folder first. Once the download is complete, navigate to the destination folder to find your photos.
